issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Method org.apache.drill.exec.util.DecimalUtility.adjustScaleMultiply(long input, int factor) can return the value bigger than long max value.
For example by comparison two decimal18 values 9223372036854775807 and 0.001. To adjust first value scale this method should return 9223372036854775807 * 1000 - bigger than long max value.

Class DecimalUtility.java will be a part of org.apache.arrow after renaming described in [DRILL-4455 Depend on Apache Arrow for Vector and Memory| https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DRILL-4455]
fields.summary: [Java] Method can return the value bigger than long MAX_VALUE

comments.body: Could you please clarify which method has the problem?

[~wesmckinn] I checked the code and found that the problem still exists. BTW, Drill have removed these methods in [DRILL-6421|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DRILL-6421], I would like to provide a PR to remove these unused methods, what do you think?
[~wesmckinn] Thanks very much for your reply, I have submitted a [PR|[https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4266]], please take a look, thanks!
